entry.name: menu
entry.desc: Themeable menu with mouse and keyboard interactions for navigation.

longdesc.p: A menu can be created from any valid markup as long as the elements have a strict parent/child relationship and each menu item has an anchor. The most commonly used element is the unordered list (UL):
longdesc.pre:
• Item 1
  • Item 2
  • Item 3
  • Item 4
  • Item 5
longdesc.p: If you use a structure other than UL/LI, including using the same element for the menu and the menu items, use the menus option to specify a way to differentiate the two elements, eg. menus: 'div.menuElement'.
Any menu item can be disabled by adding the ui-state-disabled class to that element.

option.name: menus
option.desc: Selector for the elements that serve as the menu container, including sub-menus.

option.name: position
option.desc: Using ui.position, sets where the sub-menus will open in relation to the activated item in the parent menu.

method.name: refresh
method.desc: Initializes sub-menus and menu items that have not already been initialized.

event.name: focus
event.desc: Triggered when a menu gains focus or when any menu item is activated via mouseover, click or keyboard interaction.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: Type depends on event option. Commonly would be focus, click or mouseover.

argument.name: item
argument.desc: The menu item activated by the triggering event.

event.name: blur
event.desc: Triggered when the menu loses focus.

example.desc: Initialize a menu with default options.
